betterquesting:10.desc:8:
For our next major step (the crucible) we need a hammer and an anvail.

With the crucible we can easily cast those but for now we need another way.
First make a hammer and anvil.  The easiest anvil is made from stone but only has 1 use. Making an anvil from black or red granite will last longer.  Later you can make one from your metals.  Place 2 ingots (I recommend bronze) on the anvil (one left, one right) hammer it and you get double ingot, use the anvil again and you get a plate and some scraps. You will need 8 plates for now.

Now make a file using 2 of your plates.

Next you will want make a wrench and you are almost ready to take on the world.

Finally you will need a rolling pin.  You can make this from wood.  All you need is 1 plank and 2 sticks.

Now you finally have the tools you need to make a crucible, which will be your first way to indirectly increase your ore output (when you cast plates they only cost 1 ingot worth of material, and rods only cost 0.5 ingots)
§9
Note:  You can make either a stone anvil, black granite anvil, or red granite anvil.  You can see these options by clicking the right arrow in the bottom right of the pane to the right.  The stone anvil will complete the quest but will break when you make your first plate.  I recommend to make a level 3 pick (red/black granite rocks) and mine some red/black granite stone to make the better anvils.
§f
To complete this quest make the following:
1 Hammer from rocks.
1 Stone or Black Granite or Red Granite anvil
1 File (recommend bronze or lead)
1 Wrench (recommend bronze or lead)
1 Rolling Pin *from wood plank and sticks)

Let's get a furnace.
§4§rTo make one you need a fire starter.

§cCareful: If you have found a lighter or similar in a dungeon, that also works, but will use up the whole item, so that might be a waste!.

§k§rFor the fire starter we need some dry grass, so make a knife and right click grass to collect some fresh grass.  Craft the grass 3x3 to make grass bales and place them in the sun to let them dry (be sure they are somewhere dry and not right next to a lake or out in the rain, otherwise they will get moldy)
When the bales are dry you can colelct them and then craft them back into 9 dry grass and make your fire starter.  You use 2 sticks and 1 dry grass to make a fire starter.  You might want to make multiple since we need more later anyway.

You may have noticed dead logs either laying on the ground or still standing around the landscape.  If you right click these with an axe, you will receive dry bark.  You can combine 2 sticks and the dried bar to create  a fire starter.  Be aware that fire starters do not stack so be careful filling your inventory with these. 

Your furnace can only melt a few ores like copper, tin/casserite, lead and bronze. For higher tier metals you need a crucible.  The furnace can still make galss from sand.

Make the following:
1 Flint Knife
1 Bale of Grass
1 Bale of Dried Grass
1 Fire Starter
1 Furnace

You may have noticed that the furnace is not able to melt all the ores you already have collected. To get access to those higher tier materials like iron and steel we need something generate and handle more heat.

It's time to get a crucible to go with the burning box that you just made.

The crucible (if placed above a lit burning box) will heat up continously and melt even the toughest of materials. But be careful, the material the crucible is made of determines the maximum temperature the crucible can take. Anything above and the crucible itself will melt down.

For now a ceramic crucible will be enough, it goes up to 2500K which is plenty for this technology age.

Also make some molds and a few crossings. You can place the molds directly next to the crucible without the crossings but the crossings allow you to use more molds at once. 

§cCareful: the molds themself also have a max temperature they can take, since our molds are also ceramic, they can take the same 2500K, so we are fine

§f§rFor now you can use the Brick or Bronze Burning Box.  You can upgrade the burning box to higher heat output and/or more effecient materials and different fuel types later.  There are also different fuel type burning boxes.  There are solid fuel which is wood and coal, liquid ones which use liquid fuels such as cresote and gas ones that use gas fuels such as methane and hydrogen.  For now we will stick to solid fuel burning boxes.

When using your burning box you will need to use a shovel to remove the dark ash waste.  Do that while it is running is likely to burn you.  You cna also use the shover to remove solid waste from the crucible is there are any leftovers.  1 scrap is 1 nuget of material.
§c
Warning:  When using the crucible, keep an eye on the temperature.  Right now make sure you use quick fuels such as wood or lignite coal.  As soon as the material in the crucible turns to liquid, put a block of sand, dirt or gravel infrom of the crucible.  Wait to make sure that the burning box stops burning before your pour your molds.  With little to no material in the crucible with heat very quickly and exceed the 2,500K temperature.  If it does the crucible will melt and if you are nearby, it will boil you to death.
§f
For this quest make the following:
1 Bronze or Lead Solid Burning Box
1 Ceramic Crucible
2 Ceramic Crossings
4 Clay molds

There are 2 reqards
2 Useful Books
Choose a cookie (Use the right arrow below to get to the cookies and finish the quest)

In the Stone Age you want to look for:

- small surface ores like copper/chalcopyrite, tin/casserite, lead/galena as well as coal/lignite coal.
If you find some easy accessable large ore veins of those ores, you might want to grab some too.

- Wood

- Villages and their fine loot

- Some food source (strawberries or berry bushes are great)

- If you can find a cauldron somewhere, grab it, if you wash your ores before melting them, not only do you not have to deal with the stone scraps every time, you also get some extra side products as a bonus!

= Look for some gravel as we will be needing some flint soon.

- Finally look for a nice place to settle down or at least a starting base so you and dump off resources.

- Start gathering rocks in order to look for ore veins and to gathering rocks for tools.

- Some ore veins you could use are Copper/Tetrahydrate, Tin/Cassiterite, and Redstone/Cinnabar.

Here are some general tips:


- Grab (right click) those small rocks on the ground, not only can you make early game tools out of them but they also sometimes contain traces of ore. If you found such a rock, make sure to mark that position, it means there is a large vein of that type of ore below

- Dungeon Loot and Villages can give you a nice early game boost and even can contain some valueable metals for later

- Make sure that your base will be close to the ocean or a river or at least a large lake. You will need tons of water and only in those places water is infinite.

- Read the tooltips, they contain valuable information, if you want even more info press F3+H to enable/disable advanced tooltips (it's really worth it)

- Be careful with your food, if you eat too much of the same type (e.g. sugar, protein etc) in too short of a time, you get some effects. E.g. sugar makes you faster but if you eat too much you might get diabetes.

- The area around spawn is mob spawn proof up to 128 blocks from spawn.  If you are looking for a safe place to start, start at spawn.  You can also make Greg's comsetic blocks from his stone or his dirt and these blocks are also prevent mods from spawning.

Click the button to the right to continue.

You can make tools (e.g. hammer, chisel, sword, pickaxe, axe etc) out of maaaaaany different materials. If you look in NEI you might see that some ingots/materials have something like Q: 2 S: 6.0 D: 256 (e.g iron) in their tooltip. Whenever a material has those 3 properties in their tooltip it means you can make a tool out of it and the tool will have those stats.
Q stands for quality, which means the mining/harvesting level.
S stands for speed, which is just as you already guessed the speed which you can mine/harvest blocks with
D stands for durability and is the number of uses you can use the item. The real number will be D * 100 because each use costs 100 durability on average (harvesting harder materials costs more durability, softer materials cost less)

You might have also noticed the "possible enchantments" part in the tooltip. That means if you make a tool out of that material the tool will automatically be enchanted with those enchantments, isn't that great?

One enchant is Fortune.  Starting in Gregtech version 6.14.12 Greg's ores now drio Raw Ore similar to Minecraft 1.17 if your tool contains Furtune.  Higher the fortune level, the more Raw Ore that drops.  To get fortune you need the right material.  The first material is Soularium (9 soulsand dusts and 1 gold) in the crucible.  This will give Fortune I.  Later there is Efrine tools that give Fortune II.  The final material is Jade which will give you Fortune III.  Jade is available as small ores in the world and can be made into gems using an autoclave.  You can also make Greg's Boomsticks and dynamite to bast ores for up to Fortune V.

Click the button to the right to continue.

Alloys allow you to make different items and to use are replacement in some machine if you are running short of other metals.

Now we are going to make some Brass.  Barass is 3 ingots of copper and 1 ingot of Zinc,

You probably got some zinc from small zinc ores on the surface or while mining.  You can also get Zinc from Sphalerite.

To complete this quest pour 4 ingots of Brass from the crucible.

You need something to transport water, a wooden bucket is cheap and not only allows you to get some agriculture going, but also allows you to fill up your cauldron (if you managed to find one) to wash your ores. You also will need it to make treated wood planks for fluid pipes in the steam age.

Need to make:
1 Wooden Bucket

Copper tools are really bad (quality 0 and low durability), time to get something better.
First make a mixing bowl, then right click it with some copper nuggest and tin nuggest (3:1 ratio) and then mix it with an empty hand.
You now have bronze compound, you can melt it in the furnace to get bronze nuggets.
Use a crafting table to combine the nuggets into ingots.

Make the following:
1 Mixing Bowl
36 Bronze Compound
4 Bronze Ingots

Flint tools are a great early game choice. If you can't find flint anywhere use rocks but you really want some flint for a knife,  Gather some sticks from the ground and pick up some stones.  If some of the rocks are ores, mark that location so you can come back later to mine the ore.  Ore bearing rocks indicate that there is an ore block somewhere below that rock location.  This is the primary way to find ore blocks.

§cTip:  You can get flint from gravel.  Using your first piece of flint to make a shovel will make gathering garvel much faster.
§f
All flint tools automatically get the fire aspect enchantment, which means huting for meat yields cooked meat!
§b
Some information aboujt rocks:
All rocks have a specific level due to the hardness of the rock.  This hardness will determine which rocks a pick axe can mine and the durability and how many uses that tool will have.
For example Minecraft stone, diorite, limestone and marble are all level 1 stones so you can mine with a level 1 pick axe or higher.  A level 1 pick axe is made of these same rocks or flint.
Level 2 stone such as Basalt, Komatite, or Kimberlite are level 2 rocks so if you want to mine these rocks, you will need a pick made of these rocks.
Level 3 stone such as Black Granite and Red Granite are level 3 rocks so if you want to mine these rocks, you will need a pick made of these rocks.  These rocks have the best durability of all stone tools.
§4
Pro tip:  Make a hammer from 6 red/black granite and you can mine a piece of red/black granite.  This will give you red/black cobblestone.  Place that red/black cobble on the ground and mine wit with you hammer will result in 3-4 red/black granite rocks to make more level 3 tools. 
§f
Goals:
Gather flint and rocks and make the following tools:
1 Pickaxe from flint or rocks
1 Axe from flint or rocks
1 Shovel from flint or rocks

You want to invest into a coke oven, not only do you get useful creosote oil (which can be used as fuel and to treat wood for better pipes and tanks) you also increase the energy output of your coal.

You can also make charcoal in the coke oven (which you couldn't do in the furnace)

To start the process fill it with some coal and righ click the oven main block with a fire starter (or any other fire making device) It will run as long as it has items and storage for output.

§6Tip: Place a hopper on top of it to auto insert. Place a hopper below to auto remove the output items. A pipe on any of the bottom blocks also outputs the fluid.

Tip: If you have an advanced crafting table with a water tank next to it, crafting the fire bricks is much easier.
§f
To complete this quest you will ened to craft:
26 Fire Bricks (Use 25 for the Coke Oven)
1 Coke Oven (Uses 1 Fire Bricks in recipe)

Do you think sometimes 'it would be great to have a crafting table that holds it's items and also has some storage for all the tools i need'? Wouldn't it even better when that crafting table also refills your buckets with fluid when placed next to a tank with that fluid?
Say no more, here is the advanced crafting table!

To complete this quest craft:
1 Advanced Crafting Table from bronze

The drain and the capacity of the wooden pipes are a bit limited.  Lets get a tank to store some water where it can auto refil your buckets or jsut to buffer some water for you cauldron.

To insert fluid into a tank you need a funnel (right clicking the tank itself doesnt work)

To get it out again, you use the tap.

The tank will keep it's storage when broken, so you can transport water with it!

One requirement for the wooden barrel is glue.  Glue can be obtained as dungeon loot or you can put a resin from your rubber trees in a mixing bowl with water (That thing you used to make your first bronze).


§cCareful: Wooden tanks can catch fire if placed to close to a heat source (~3block radius) or you fill it with a fluid that is too hot
§f
To complete this quest craft:
1 Wooden Barrel

Search for some rubber tree saplings and plant them near your base. You can find rubber trees in cold biomes.
When they are grown you can right click the yellow'ish spots to extract some sticky resin. If you are lazy make a sap bag and place it on the resin spot, it will auto collect resin until it is full (64 items). Sadly you cannot auto extract from the bag, that has to be done by hand.

Sticky resin is usefull for all kinds of things:
- You can craft torches from it
- You can mix it together with some water (in the mixer) to make glue
- and later you can make rubber from it, which will be a huge step for your automation.

§cCareful: When you break the naturaly grown leave blocks of the tree, the resin will resplendish slower and slower until it completly stops. Let those poor trees breath!

§fTo complete this quest gather the following items:
1 Rubber Tree Sapling
1 Sap Bag
8 Resin

In the Steam Age you want to look for:

- Copper, Tetrahedrite, Chalcopyrite (you will need a ton of it)

- Tin/Casserite

- some Cobalt (makes good durable cheap tools)

- Nickel/Pentlandite (you find it together with Cobalt)

- Black Sand (found in rivers), Yellow/Brown Lemonite, Hematite

- Redstone so you can do automation and shufoffs.

- some Manganese, some Pyrolusite

- some Chromite


Optional:

- Rubber Trees (their sap is great to make torches and you can make glue out of it)

In the Stone Ages you have few options for automation but a hopper is a great idea to help with some of the cumbersome tasks.
When you check NEI, you will notice that there isn't only the vanilla iron hopper but many different hoppers out of different materials. Those hoppers are more tick friendly, so don't feel bad about using them.
The difference between the materials is how many slots each hopper contains.
The default version doesn't care about the order items are put into it, while the Queque version does care and only outputs them in the same order.
§5
§6§5§6Tip: If you use a screwdriver you can set the hopper to only pull/push a certain amount of items. They also react to redstone to enable/disable their pull/push.

Pro Tip:  Make a Vanilla Minecraft Chest (these don't burn) and place the hopper below your bruning box with the hopper going into the chest.  This will allow for your dark ash to empty out of the burning box and end up in the chest.  This will prevent the burning box from going out due to being full of ash.  Just make sure to empty your chest once a while to prevent it from filling up and backing ash back to your burning box.
§f
Craft the following item:
1 Bronze Hopper

Time to get machinery, but before we can do that we need some stuff before.
Don't get intimidated, the roadmap looks long but after we got the basics we can just plug in most steam age machinery!

Make sure to build close to a renewable water source, otherwise you need many pipes just to transport that water to you. Later you get cheap rubber pipes, where this wont be much of a problem anymore!

To get started we need some iron. Greg has changed how black sand works from earlier version of GT6.  Greg added Basaltic, and Granitic Black Sand as blocks.  First you will need to convert the sand blocks into the resulting dusts which are labeled as Mineral Sand.  This is very easy.  Just put it into your black sand blocks in your crafting grid and pull out the 9 mineral sand dusts.  Mix some basaltic or granitic mineral sand with a carbon source (coal and coal coke work great for that.  You can use other ores for iron but in the case of limonite or hematite you need to add some calcite (limestone works good for that).

§9Pro Tip:  You can use a GT barrel and put in 1 mineral sand dust.  Now when you put in additional blocks, they will be converted to the dusts automatically.

§c
Careful: Don't use lignite coal in the crucible, it will ignite and blow up. Use normal coal or coal coke.  You can use Lignit coal as fuel for the burning box.

Warning:  Sifting Basaltic or Granitic Mineral Sand no longer give the resulting dusts.  They will give you some nuggets though.
§f
To complete this quest you will need:
14 Granitic or Basaltic Sand Dusts
3 Carbon - You get the 3 carbon from 6 Crushed, Purified or gem Coal or 3 coal coke ingots.
then make 6 iron ingots using the crucible.

Many machines need KU (Kinetic Units) as powersource, a simple bronze steam engine will suffice for now to supply that need.
§6
Tip: Steam Engines output distilled water from their sides, so if you want to use that to circulate it back to your boilers, just add some pipes (they output less water than was used to make the steam for it, about 10% loss)

§fTo complete this quest craft:
1 Bronze Engine

We need a way to transport water and steam.
Cheap wooden pipes are great for water and you can put a drain on the huge wooden pipes but wooden pipes cannot handle hot steam.  Wooden pipes can also burn around burning boxes if they are in contact with an air block.

For pipes that are exposed to air near burning boxes and that can handle steam something more heat resistant is required.  For now bronze pipes will do.
§d
Tip:  Use a wrench to connect pipes to another pipe.  You will see an 'X' at the edge of the pip if they are connecting while you are holding a wrench.  The wrench will connect or disconnect the pipes.  To remove wooden pipes you will need a saw.  To remove metal pipes, you will need a wrench.
§f
To compelte this quest you will need to craft:
8 Huge Wooden Pipes
4 Small Bronze Pipes

A boiler converts water into steam if supplied with a heat source
§c
Careful: If your boiler runs out of water but is still supplied with heat, it can melt
Careful: If your boiler accumulates to much pressure (e.g. the steam isn't removed or a too strong heat source is used) it can blow up
§l§l§r§cCareful: If your boiler is empty AND hot and is supplied with water, it will blow up. Make sure to only supply water to cold boilers or boilers that are not empty
§f
If you supply a boiler with normal water, it will calcify over time, thus reducing it's effiency. You can decalcify your boiler by either removing it and placing it again or using a chisel on it.
Even better, supply your boiler with destilled water and it will never calcify
§c
Careful: If you use a chisel on a hot boiler to decalcify it, it will blow up. Make sure it's cold
§f
To complete this quest craft:
1 Bronze Burning Box
1 Bronze Boiler

betterquesting:10.name:8: It Just Went Down the Drain
betterquesting:10.desc:8:
We need to collect water and doing that by hand isn't enough anymore.

A drain will collect water from a water source and fill a pipe.  The drain is made from iron.

Craft a drain, put it on one of your huge wooden pipes that is submerged in water and it will start collecting it.
§d
Pro Tip: Make sure the drain is placed in water that is in the river biome otherwise the water source might go dry.  
§f
To complete this quest craft:
1 Drain

As mentioned before, if you supply your boiler with normal water it will calcify and loose effiencency. It's time to use all that nice steel you made to solve that issue.
A dryer, alongside many other purposes, can process water to distilled water, which wont calcify your boilers at all! It's a worthwhile investment.

Another use would be to dry your sluice juice so that you can send it through a magnetic separator to get additional byproduct.

To complete this quest craft:
1 Steel Dryer

Many machines need RU (Rotation Units) as powersource, a simple bronze steam turbine will suffice for now to supply that need.  If you want you can make an Invar Turbine that can make more power.  The only difference is the the 4 Invar rotors.  The hull is still bronze.
§6
Tip: Steam Turbines output distilled water from their sides, so if you want to use that to circulate it back to your boilers, just add some pipes (they output less water than was used to make the steam for it, about 10% loss)
§f
To complete the quest by crafting:
1 Bronze Turbine or Invar Turbine

Time for steel!
To make steel all we have to do is put some iron in a crucible (dont fill it all up, it needs some space for air), heat it to at least 2044K and pump some air in it.
After a while (depending on the speed of which you pump air in) the color of your liquid will become red and your steel is done.

How do you pump air into the crucible you ask?  Oh yeah, you just place the output of the engine to the back of the crucible (dont forget to supply it with steam so it actually runs).

To complete this quest pour 8 ingots of steel.

The crusher doubles your ore output, over are the days where you had to crush your ores by hand with a hammer, now you can let a machine do the work and even get double the output!

To complete the quest craft:
1 Bronze Crusher

This machine replaces the manual sifter table when you are tired of right-clicking

To complete this quest craft:
1 Bronze Sifter

The sluice gives you plenty of side products from your ores (similar to the cauldron) but it also gives you valuable sluice juice. You can dry it and put it into a magnetic seperator or just centrifuge it for even more sideproducts!
§d
Tip:  Build a tank to store your sluice juice until you can either dry it or centrifuge it.
§f
To complete this quest craft:
1 Bronze Sluice

The shredder doesnt double your ores (thats what the crusher is for), but it dusts down all things you throw in it, even full machines, to get their crafting materials back.  In order to make a shredder you will need a Flawless Diamond.  You can craft the flawless Diamond into a crystaline diamond plate.

In order to complete this quest craft:
1 Bronze Shredder

Now that we have Brass we can make some item pipes.  Item pipes can move your items from one machine to another or to chests and barrels so you don't have to manually move them by hand.

To complete this quest craft:
4 Brass Item Pipes

To get more out of your ores we need to wash it.
There are multiple ways of washing, like normal water washing, sluice and chemical washing.
Currently all we can do is normal washing in a cauldron.
Fill up a cauldron with water and throw crushed ores into it.
§6
Tip: If you hook a pipe on the cauldron it can fill up automatically. But that only works if your pipe is big enough (a huge treated pipe works)
§c
Careful: Washing ores gives all kind of side products. Some of them can be radioactive (e.g. Cobalt-60). Radioactive materials are not good for your health
§f
To complete this quest craft or find:
1 Cauldron

Now that you ahve a bottle of mercury, it is time to make a thermometer.

You will need 4 pieces of glass, 1 copper plate, and some red dye to make the thermometer.

Let's make a thermometer, right-click the crucible with it to measure it's current temperature.  The temperature will apepar in the chat box.

Make the following:
1 Thermometer

Let's do some engineering.
We need some redalloy wire, a temperature sensor, a piston, and a lever.

The temperature sensor is good for giving you a readout of the crucible temperature.  It can also be configured to trigger a redstone signal if it reaches a specific temperature.  This expample would be to add a automatic cutoff with manual shutoff lever.

Now place the sensor against your crucible, right-click it with a screwdriver (not on the buttons or the display, that will change other things) to change it to > mode.

The sensor will now output a redstone signal whenever it is above the set temperature.
Set the desired temperature by right-clicking the buttons with an empty hand.

Now place the piston next to your burning box, so that when it extends it's covering the front of the burning box. Since burning boxes need air in front of them to work, when the piston extends it will stop burning.

Now connect the sensor with the piston, using the red alloy wire (you might want to use a wire cutter to make it easier).  you can put a lever on the piston to manually trigger the piston to shutoff the burning box.

Done, you now have an auto shutoff for your crucible :)

There are multiple ways to build these systems.  One would be to bury the biston 2 blocks below and 1 block in front of the burning box and to use glass on top of the piston.  That way when the piston is actrivated, you can look through the glass to see when the burning box stops burning.

§c§4§c
Careful: a burning box will always finish burning it's current fuel item, that means it's best to use short burning time fuels like nuggets or tiny/small dusts. Make sure to have some leave some buffer for your allowed temperature to accomidate for those extra delays!
§f
To complete this quest you need to craft:
1 Thermometer Sensor
1 Sticky Piston
4 Restone Alloy Wire
1 Lever

Some crused or purified gem dusts will need to be sifted to get gems or actual gem dusts.  One example that needs this process is diamonds.  You will need a diamond gem for some of the ore processing machines.  If you are not luck enough to get one from a small diamond ore block, you will need to do manual sifting.
§d
Tip:  It is not always beneficial to sift all gem ores.  It depends of the ore and what gems or dusts you need.
§f
To complete this quest you need to craft:
1 Sifting Table

You might have noticed that NEI shows recipes in machines with GU/t as power usage and total GU used for a recipe.
Catalyst has many different power types, which can be converted between each other (for example you can use EU (electrical units) to power a motor with will produce RU (rotational units). Here are all types that exist in Catalyst

GU - Generic Units (just used in NEI to show recipes, the machine itself will convert any other power types 1:1 into GU to produce the recipe)

EU - Electrical Units

RF - Redstone Flux

RU - Rotational Units (for everything that needs some spin)

KU - Kinetic Units

HU - Heat Units

LU - Light Units (made by lasers to power welders etc)

QU - Quantum Units (used by high tech machines)

Converting between different energy types is not always looseless, it depends on the machines you use (always check the tooltips)

Let's talk about machines.
Most machines in Gregtech cannot be powered directly with RF or Electricity. Instead depending on the machine you have to hook up other machines that output different power types to your factory, kind of like a semi multiblock.
§7§9§e§k§l§l§k§m§m§r§1§2§3§4§5§6§7§9
E.g:
Lets say you have an Oven, instead of hooking up a cable directly to it you power it with Heat (HU). So you place a burning box or electric heater below it. In case of the electric heater you power this one with EU.

Now lets give a more complex example:
Say you are in the steam age and want to power your crusher for ore doubling.
The Crusher needs KU, which you get from an engine, which itself needs to be supplied with steam to work, the steam comes from a boiler, which needs HU to convert water to steam, so you place a burning box below the boiler.
§f
All machines have a range in which they can work. If you supply less, it wont do anything and if you supply more than the max it either stops working or melts down or even explodes. Make sure to supply your machines inside their working range!


Some explanation about recipes:

Costs - the total cost the recipe costs in GU (the actual type depends on the specific machine, it will convert all other types into GU 1:1 internally)
Usage - the minimum GU/t you have to supply, if you supply less, the machine will not be able to process the recipe and get stuck (if that happens, either supply the right amount of energy/t or use a rubber-hammer/harvest-and-replace the machine to reset it, the items for the recipes are lost this way though)
Tier&Power are interesting for overclocking recipes (more of that in later ages)
Time - the time the recipe takes to finish, given you supply the exact amount needed (if you supply more, the machine will finish faster)

Who wants to wait all the time until the metal in the mold cooled down long enough to be safely removed. Also doing it all by hand is annoying.
If you make a monkey wrench and use it on the sides of a mold it enables/disables the auto input of that side. If you use it on the center of the mold it toggles it's redstone behaviour of all sides.
Combine that with a hopper below the mold and you can automatically (or on a lever flip) do your metal casting. (it gets even better when you have a thermonometer)

Craft the following item:
1 Monkey Wrench

In the Progression Age you want to look for:

- Chrome/Chromite

- Manganese/Pyrolusite

- Redstone

- Nickel/Pentlandite

- Tungsten/Scheelite/Wolframite/
   Ferberite/Huebnerite

- Oil

- Black Sand/Lemonite/Hematite

- Tantalum/Tantalite

We have to start mixing acids and not only fluid acids but also gaseous acids, which means our old stone age hand mixing bowl isn't doing us any good.

4 auto mixer should be good enough for now.

We are starting to work with acids, so we need some material that is acid proof.
Lets make stainless steel.
I recommend you make an automated system from some hoppers, a bit of redstone and a dedicated crucible. It will be worth it, because we will need A LOT OF IT.


Stainless steel is an alloy of 4 wrough iron, 3 invar, 1 chromium and 1 manganese.  For now lets make our first stainless steel in our crucible.  You should have get your chromium and manganese from byprodusts of your ore processing.

Requires:
4 Iron or Wrought Iron Ingots
3 Invar Ingots
1 Chromium dust
1 Manganese dust

Make 6 stainless steel plates and 2 stainless steel long rods.

You can pour the rest as what every you want but I wsould suggest some bolts.

We need some sulfuric acid. Not only can we refine many things with it, we can make other acids out of it too!
And what laboratory is complete without a full set of acids.

Let's get to work.


First step is sulfur dioxide, which we get from roasting things like sulfur or pyrite.
Then we mix that sulfur dioxide with air (you can get that from an air vent). But for the mix to work we also need a catalyst like platinium or vanadium dust. It doesn't get used up but needs to be there.

Now we have sulfur trioxide, which we now mix with some water and we get sulfuric acid!

§cCareful: Not all pipes can handle acids, make sure to read the pipe description if it can handle it!
Mix some sulfuric acid with salt and get hydrochloric acid

We need some really heat resistant materials now, so lets get the best: Tungsten!

Other than most ores tungsten can't just be thrown raw into a crucible and cast into ingots, we first have to refine the ore.

Thats were the acids we made before come in play.

Bath your tungsten containing dust (like sheelite, wolframite etc) in hydrochloric acid and get tungstic acid dust.
Throw that into a dryer to get tungsten trioxide dust.
Now we mix the tungsten trioxide dust with some hydrogen in a mixer to get the pure tungsten dust, which we can now melt in our upgraded crucible!

This is the alternative route of upgrading your crucible, this route needs less precise shutoff mechanisms, but you need a bunch of those meteors you found while picking up rocks from the ground.

Make a meteoric steel cruicible and at least 1 mold

If you chose the meteoric steel path you can either go with the iridium crucible or make a niobium one.

Make a niobium crucible and at least 1 mold

Let's make a crucible that can withstand 4111K without melting!
This will allow us to melt tungsten, which is what we are after.

Make a tantalum crucible and at least 1 mold

Invar is an alloy of 2 Iron and 1 Nickel.  Invar is a very useful material.  It makes the most efficient burning boxes, better fluid pipes, higher capacity tanks and can be used as better rotors insidebor better turbines.

To complete this quest pour 6 Invar ingots from your crucible.

We start working with ever higher melting point materials, so it's time to upgrade our crucible.

There are 2 routes to go, with as many in between steps as you like, this quest line shows the most straight forward one. But be aware that while this route works, it needs some very precise work with your heat control. Sometimes we work within a 6K range!

For this route, get a cromium crucible and at least 1 mold

Regardless which route you choose, now you can make the iridium crucible. If you choose the Chrome path, make sure that your shutoff is precise!

Make an iridium crucible and at least 1 mold

With access to tungsten we can finally make the smelter.
The smelter can melt all metals like a crucible but never gets to hot and gives you easy access to the liquid form of the metals.

Using the smelter is not very energy efficent compared to the crucible but it's quality of life aspect compared to the access of liquid metals makes it well worth it.

Roasting is a great way to get more out of your stuff.
In this case we want some sulfurdioxide. Roasting sulfur, pyrite etc will give us plenty of that.

Now it is time to use the sticky resin to make something more useful than glue and torches.  Lets use some of that stainless steel and make a coagulator.  This will turn the sticky resin into rubber which can be used to replace your wooden pipes with some that will not burn (i.e. rubber pipes).

Requires
Coagulator

Now we can combine the efforts of oil refinement and the long path for tungsten to get plastic !

Put your titanium tetrachloride together with ethylene or propylene and use magnesium chloride dust as a catalyst in a mixer.

If you use the plastic pulp in an extruder you get 1 plastic per pulp, otherwise you get 6 plastic nuggets per pulp from the oven/furnace

I hope you made that stainless steel automation system, because otherwise this will feel very grindy.
To process oil into all types of different fuels and other sideproducts we need a distillation tower.

Why would we do such an insane expensive project? Glad you asked. Not only do we get much more Energy out of the process than we spent, we also get some important side products to make plastics out of, and plastic means computer chips. Still not interested? ;)

I hope you marked those oil spots you may have found while exploring, because now we need it.
It probably makes sense to build a small rail transport network to get it in your base.

Make a drum to make it easier for you to transport fluids/gases.
The stainless steel drum can not only handle both, but also acids, so it's perfect for our needs.

Now that we have Butane and Propane lets further refine that to make ethylene.
Craft a steam cracker, hook it up to a heat source and a boiler (you know the drill).
§c

Careful: The steam cracker can only hold 2000L of steam, so make sure your boiler doesnt blow up.

§fA pressure valve might be a good idea, if you haven't made one yet. So get one too.

Melt some calcite (limestone works great for that), combine that with chloride (you can get that from bathing different ores or from the electrolizer), Rutile or Ilmenite dust and some coal coke dust. You get Titanium Tetrachloride from that which you can process to titanium ingots, but first we want to use it for plastic.

The treated wood tank can only hold 432,000 liters.  That may sound like alot but it fills up quickly.  If you need more storage or if you need to store gasses (gasses don't work with treated wood), you will need a different tank.  This is where Invar tanks come in handy.  Small Invar tanks hold 1,728,000 liters and need the same 3x3 space as the treated wood tank.  It can also hold gasses.  There are also large versions of the tanks but they require significantly more invar to create but can hold significantly larger amounts of non-acidic fluids.

Warning:  Invar tanks cannot hold gasses.  You will need stainless steel tanks for that.

To complete the quest craft:
25 Invar Walls
1 Small Invar Main Tank Valve

Now that you have some iron, you can make a Grindstone.  A Grindstone is useful in converting raw pickaxe heads into pickaxes heads and to make other useful tools like a magnifying glass.  The grindstone uses sandstone blocks instead of your file duribility.

Note:  You can make sandstone by crafting 4 sand into a sandstone block.

To complete the quest:
Craft 1 Grindstone

Clay molds should be the first molds for you to make. You can reuse them and they can take quite some temperature (up to 2500K)

As with all molds you can chisel the right pattern into the molds when placed in world (after cooked in the furnace to make them ceramic) but it's much easier to define the pattern beforehand in the raw clay.

You want at least 1 plate mold (Yay finally your plates dont cost you 2 ingots anymore), an ingot mold, a rod mold and one pickaxe mold (so you can make metal tools which are just much faster and durable than stone tools).

Be aware that metal molds dont come with a predefined pattern and you have to chisel those in world (but you dont have to worry about that for now)!
§c§d
Pro Tip:  You can use a clay brick for an ingot, a stick for a rod, some wood planks for plates, and a wooden pick axe for the pick axe mold.  As these items will be comsumed, you won't loose your precious metal in making these molds.  Also when making other molds from your metal tools (Axe, File, Hammer, etc) if you use a full tool (one with a handle) instead of just hte tool head, the tool will take some duribility damage instead of being consumed in the crafting process.
§f
Craft the follwoing items:
1 Ingot Clay Mold
1 Rod Clay Mold
1 Plate Clay Mold
1 Pick Axe Clay Mold

Gregtech has many items and many of them you need again and again. To make it easier to find the recipes here are some tips on NEI usage in Gregtech:

- You can press 'a' while hovering over an item in NEI to add it to your favorite list on the left side, press it again while hovering on the same item, to remove it again.

- A nice way to not loose track of what you are currently progression towards is to favorite the items you work on.

- Type meta.tools in the NEI searchbar to get all main tools listed [Does this even work?]

Click the box to the right to continue.

Feel your furnace is too slow? Need some speed in your life?
Then the new Gregtech Steel Oven might be for you.

Just supply it with some HU from the burning box of your choice and see it make all your dreams of personal cooking come true. Higher tier variants accept even more heat and thus run even faster!

You can use a Bronze Burning Box but for faster speed you can use a Steel Burning Box

To complete this quest craft:
1 Steel Oven

Our next step towards plastic is Titanium Tetrachloride, but for that we need a burner mixer.
The burner mixer needs some RU but also needs to be lit by a firestarter/bic/flint&steel similar to the coke oven.

You will need some food while you are out looking for resources.  While you are out you will see Gregtech berry bushes.  Although the berries can be eaten by themselves, you don't get much nutriton from them.  If you use your 2x2 self crafting grid and put the berries equally split between 2 of the squares and put your trusty knife in one of the other squares, you will be able to make a fruit salad.  Not only is the fruit salad fill you up and add to you saturation, you will receive a speed and jump bonus.  These fruit salads will do for now until you can make better food.

§cWarning:  Eating too many fruit salads will lead to a premature dath from diabetes.  Eat you fruit salads in moderation to reduce you chances of dying.

§fObjective:  Find some berries and make 4 fruit salads.

Now is the time to make some additional tools that are needed to get you through the stone age and beyond.  You will need to make a saw so you can cut rods and wood.  You will need a screwdriver to assemble anything that contains a screw.  You should have a handy set of pincers to quickly take intems out of your molds without burning yourself to death.  It also allows you to use your liquid metal before is solidifies in your crucible.  A soft hammer will be useful when making items out of wood like your first pipes.  Finally a pair of wire cutters will be useful to make some wire for machines and dealing with redstone alloy wires needed for automation.
§d
Pro Tip:  You can make a mold of your saw and screwdriver using the tool and a clay mold.  If you use the completed tool, the tool wil ltake some durability damage but will not be consumed.  If you use just hte tool head, it will be comsumed when making a mold.  There are no molds for the pincers, soft hamer, and wire cutters.
§f
So we are going to make:
1 Saw
1 Screwdriver
1 Set of Pincers. 
1 Soft Hammer
1 Wire Cutters

You will need to defend yourself from mobs while you are out exploring.  You also may need to get meat from some animals.  With gregtech you have a couple options.

The first is to use a piece of flint and a stick to make a knife.  The knife has fire aspect which give burning damage to mobs.  It also will cook the meat from animals giving you something you can eat.

The otehr option is a club.  You can make a club from the stones that you collect.  This will last abit longer than the knife, it does not give ticking burning damage like the knife.

Make the following:
1 Flint Knife
1 Stone Club

We need a thermometer in order to know exactly the temperature of the crucible.  In order to make a thermometer, you will need Mercury.  So how do we get mercury?

We get mercury from Cinnabar ore.  Cinnabar is found in the same vein as redstone.  So if you found a redstone vein, there is most likely cinnabar there too.  You will need a level 2 pick to mine the cinnabar ore.  So mine down to the Redstone Cinnabar vein.  Near the top of the vein there should be small cinnabar ores.  These are the ones that you want.  You are looking to gather 3 crushed cinnabar ores.  Each crushed Cinnabar ore makes 3 nuggets of mercury.  White you are there gather some small restone ores as they will be needed soon.
§e§e§c
§9§f§eNote:  If you cannot find Cinnabar Ore, you can wash Crushed Redstone in a cauldon and get purified cinnabar ore for the recipe.
§f
Once you have gathered the 3 crushed cinnabar ores (maybe gather a few more incase something goes wrong), you will need to get the mercury from the crushed ore.  Mercury is an interesting metal.  It is liquid at room temperature.  So Gregtech 6 gives you 2 options to get the mercury:

First you can put 3 cinnabar crushed ores in a crucible.  Use a shovel to remove the scrap stone.  Once you start to get scrap mercury, put the mercury back in the crucible.  Next use 1 stick and light the burning box.  This should give you the mercury.  

Second you can put the 3 crushed cinnabar ores in a vanilla furnace.  Once you smelt the ore, you should get 9 nuggets of mercury.  Now take the 9 nuggets of mercury and drop them into the crucible.  The nuggests will turn to liquid immediately and you do not need to light the burning box.


The final step is to use a glass bottle and right-click the crucible to capture the mercury.  Be careful to not continue to right-click because you could drink the mercury (As Greg himself found out one day).  If you drink the mercury, you are likely to die from mercury poisoning.

Get the following items:
1 Glass Bottle
3 Crushed Cinnabar Ores
1 Mercury Bottle

By now you may have chest after chest full of all of the different cobblestones, dark ash, dirt, gravel, and sand.  You need to do something different with your stoarage so you can find what you need.  So lets use a Gregtech Item Barrel.  

These barrels are made from wood and a couple of long rods.  The best metal to use at this time is lead or bronze.  The long rods can be crafted using 2 regular rods on an anvail or using a long rod mold.

Each item barrel can hold 5,000 of the same item.  This makes these barrels good for holding your cobble, clay, or other mass item.

To complete this quest craft:
2 Lead or 2 Bronze item Barrels

Remeber you can see the otehr option to complete the quest by clicking the right arrow in the lower right of the right pane.

Now that you have your coke over running we need a better tank.  We can get some treated wood and make a wooded tank.  This will come in handy soon to hold our distilled water.

To complete this quest craft:
26 Wood Walls *25 needed for the tank structure
1 Wood Main Valve (Uses 1 Wood Wall to craft)

Greg has added a Brick Burning Box which can be used in early game with a crucible to directly make bronze instead of using the bronze mixing bowl recipe.

Note:  The Brick burnign box is only 25% effecient so it should only be used to make brinze so you can upgrade to the Bronze Burning Box.

You will need to make:
8 Brick
1 Fire Starter
1 Brick Burning Box

You need a good burning box.  In earlier GT6 versions you would need to make a lead burning box but not any longer.  Even if you created a Brick Burning Box, you will need a better burning box.  Bronze is the best as it provides more heat units and 75% effeciency or the brick or lead burning boxes.  At this point the lead is not really worth it any longer.  So your task is to make a Bronze Burning Box.

You will need:
12 Bricks
1 Double copper plate
4 Bronze plates.

You will also need a wrench to make the burning box.

Now that you have a coke oven, you can use to creosote to treat wood so you can make a decent tank.  To treat your wood early in the game, you will need a Wooden Bathing Pot.  You9 can use a ceramic tap to get the creosote from the coke oven and and bath your wood planks in the bathing pot by right clicking.

To complete the quest you will need the following:
1 Ceremic Tap
1 Wooden Bathjing Pot
10 Treated planks

betterquesting:10.name:8: Its Better to See You my Dear
betterquesting:10.desc:8:
Now that we have a grindstone lets make a magnifying glass.  The magnifying glass is made from glass panes and right-clicking on the sandstone in the grindstine.  Magnifying glasses are great for letting you know how much fluids you have in your tanks, the type and amount of fluids in your pipes.  A Magnifying glass will even tell you the type, and amount of fluid and if any calcification are in your boilers,  This is an extremely useful tool to have.

You can make more durable magnifying glasses from gems but for now we will make a glass one.  Get a pane of glass and right-click on the grindstone until you get a lens.  The craft a stick and lens to make your magnifying glass.

Note:  You can craft glass panes by using the default Minecraft recipe or you can use your crucible and pour the glass into the plate mold.

To complete the quest:
Get 1 pane of glass
Get 1 stick
Craft 1 Magnifying Glass
For more machines that require a turbine
Machines that require the engine for power

Lets make a Buzzsaw that can be used to make planks for logs, make sticks from samplings, or make plates from some gems and blocks.

Note:  You will need a steel version for the gem and metal plates.  Uou will see the machine type as "Cutter" in NEI.

To complete the quest:
Craft 1 Bronze or Steel Buzzsaw

A lathe is used to make sticks from planks, make screws from bolts, lenses from plates along with other useful recipes.

Note:  Almost all lathe recipes only require 16 RU so there is no reason to make higher tiered Lathes unless you really want to.

To Complete this quest:
Craft 1 Bronze lathe

The Roll Bender is a very sueful machine that will save you from making anvails.  This machine will make the curved plates from plates, and springs from long rods.  It even has a recipe ro make a bucket from 3 curved iron plates.

To complete this quest:
Craft 1 Bronze Roll Bender

The Rolling Mill is used to make plates from ingots.  You can make double plates from double ingots, and so forth.

To complete this quest:
Craft 1 Bronze Rolling Mill

The Cluster Mill is used to make 4 foils from 1 plate.

To complete this quest:
Clast 1 Bronze Cluster Mill

The Wiremill is used to make 2 wires from an ingot or 4 fine wire from a rod.

To complete this quest:
Craft 1 Bronze wiremill

betterquesting:10.name:8: The De-Bark is Worse Than the Bite
betterquesting:10.desc:8:
The Debarker is used to remove bark off of a log tom make beams.  You get more planks from a beam than a log.  Plus you get bark that can be used as a fuel or to make pellets for better solid fuel.

To complete the quest:
Craft 1 Bronze Debarker

The compressor is used to create dense plates from 9 regular plates.

To complete this quest:
Craft 1 Bronze Compressor

The squeezer is used to create oils and juices from different food and seeds.

To complete the quest:
Craft 1 Bronze Squeezer

The Loom is useful in making wool from string, or industrial hemp fibers.  You can also make rope to climb down shafts or frames for your bees.

To complete the quest:
Craft 1 Bronze Loom

The Roll Former is used to make rails so you can make track for your minecarts.

To Complete this quest:
Craft 1 Bronze Roll Former

The Extruder is a very useful machine as you can make almost every shape by melting ingots.  The low heat version can do low temperature metals (Copper, Tine, Bronze, and Brass).  You can also use the low temperature extruder for rubber and plastic shapes.  You will need a Tungston version for iron, steel and others.

You use a extruder plate shape to make the shape that you want.  You can make plates, curved plates, wires, cells, rods, pipes, and lots more by have the appropiate extruder plate.

To complete this quest:
Craft 1 Low Heat Extruder (Steel)

Now that you have your low heat extrucer, you need low heat extruder shapes.  You first need to make steel double plates.  Once you have your steel double plate, you will need your wire cutrters, file, and hammer to make the empty extruder shape. Then you use your wire cutters and the empty extrucer shape in a crafting grid to get the approciate shape.  Some shapes may require you to make a different shape first.  We will try a few useful shapes.

To complete this quest:
Make 3 Low Heat Empty Extruder Shapes
Make 1 Long Rod Extruder Shape
Make 1 Wire Extruder Shape
Make 1 Normal Pipe Extruder Shape
No Description

The Stone Age doesn't allow you many automatic systems, most is defined by manual labor, but all empires start from the dust.

Goal: Crucible & Molds

The Steam Age is (together with the Progression Age) your home for some time. It starts slow but after you got your basic boiler setup you will have more than ore doubling and much automation.

Goal:
No Description
Now it is time to let the machines to take over.
